definition: to go and live with one's wife's family, in effect becoming a member of her family
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]
superfluous/redundant/cumbersome/refers to a son-in-law living with wife's family

sentences.english: He was adopted into the bride's family.

definition: to marry and live with the bride's family (inverting traditional Chinese expectations)
to break a promise of marriage
to take a wife/to get married (man)
(of a woman) to marry a man of lower social status/to marry down
(of a woman) to marry/to marry off a daughter/to shift (blame etc)
to take a wife/to marry (a woman)
to remarry (of a widow)/second wife/qin and se 琴瑟[qin2 se4], two string instruments as a symbol of marital harmony
